meanings.definition: The middle of the day; noon.
meanings.sent1: At midnoon, the sun is directly overhead.
meanings.sent2: Let's meet for lunch at midnoon.
meanings.sent3: The town square was deserted at midnoon, everyone must be napping.
meanings.sent4: In the hustle and bustle of midnoon, time seems to stand still.
meanings.sent5: The brightness of midnoon can be quite intense.

meanings.definition: The time of day when the sun is at its highest point in the sky.
meanings.sent1: During midnoon, shadows are at their shortest.
meanings.sent2: Farmers take a break from work at midnoon to avoid the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The cat always finds a sunny spot to nap at midnoon.
meanings.sent4: The heat of midnoon makes the asphalt shimmer like a mirage.
meanings.sent5: Birds chirp loudly at midnoon, celebrating the peak of the day.
